articles.headline: Privacy Pitfalls as Education Apps Spread Haphazardly
articles.snippet: Apps and other software can put powerful teaching tools at teachers’ fingertips, but concerns abound over data security, effectiveness and marketing.
articles.abstract: Apps and other software can put powerful teaching tools at teachers’ fingertips, but concerns abound over data security, effectiveness and marketing.
articles.lead_paragraph: At school districts across the country, the chief technology officers responsible for safeguarding student data are tearing their hair out.

articles.headline: Retirement Reality Is Catching Up With Me
articles.snippet: Nearly 58, a writer has largely ignored his cursory efforts to plan for retirement. But his ignorance keeps gnawing at him, and it’s time to take a hard look at where he stands.
articles.abstract: Nearly 58, a writer has largely ignored his cursory efforts to plan for retirement. But his ignorance keeps gnawing at him, and it’s time to take a hard look at where he stands.

articles.headline: The Rub: Remodel or Move?
articles.snippet: Baby boomers are often choosing to live in places outside the usual retirement spots — or stay where they are and remodel their homes.
articles.abstract: Baby boomers are often choosing to live in places outside the usual retirement spots — or stay where they are and remodel their homes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Neil Shapiro considers himself “within shouting distance” of retirement. He and his wife could have sold their home near Chicago and bought a condo in the Sun Belt, long a lure for American retirees.

articles.headline: U.S. Banks Pass Stress Tests, Some With an Asterisk
articles.snippet: Bank of America must resubmit its capital plan, while units of Deutsche Bank and Santander of Spain failed the tests outright.
articles.abstract: Bank of America must resubmit its capital plan, while units of Deutsche Bank and Santander of Spain failed the tests outright.
articles.lead_paragraph: All the large United States banks passed an annual regulatory test that aims to assess whether they can make it through a financial and economic calamity, the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Slack, the Office Messaging App That May Finally Sink Email
articles.snippet: The start-up Slack is changing the way workers communicate, with a group chat app that eschews privacy and automatically archives almost everything.
articles.abstract: The start-up Slack is changing the way workers communicate, with a group chat app that eschews privacy and automatically archives almost everything.
articles.lead_paragraph: People in the tech industry have been digging a grave for email for more than a decade, but their predictions have always seemed a little out of touch.

articles.headline: Secret Service Inquiry Follows Agents’ Crash at White House
articles.snippet: The latest occurrence follows a series of scandals and mishaps for the agency, including an embarrassing history with drinking episodes.
articles.abstract: The latest occurrence follows a series of scandals and mishaps for the agency, including an embarrassing history with drinking episodes.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Two senior Secret Service agents are under investigation for allegations that they crashed a government-issued car into a White House barricade after a night of drinking last week, prompting a new inquiry into personal misconduct by employees of the widely criticized law enforcement agency, officials said Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Utah Passes White-Collar Felon Registry
articles.snippet: The Utah Legislature has approved legislation to build the nation’s first white-collar offender registry, affixing a scarlet letter of sorts on the state’s financial felons.
articles.abstract: The Utah Legislature has approved legislation to build the nation’s first white-collar offender registry, affixing a scarlet letter of sorts on the state’s financial felons.
articles.lead_paragraph: With just a point and a click, you can browse a face book of felons, a new government website that will warn of the danger these criminals pose to society.

articles.headline: Ferguson Police Chief Thomas Jackson Joins Exodus of City Officials
articles.snippet: Since the Department of Justice released a scathing report, the city manager and Municipal Court judge have also stepped down.
articles.abstract: Since the Department of Justice released a scathing report, the city manager and Municipal Court judge have also stepped down.
articles.lead_paragraph: FERGUSON, Mo. — The city’s embattled police chief, the focus of complaints after a white officer fatally shot an unarmed black teenager here last August, agreed to resign Wednesday, as part of the near-complete shake-up of the city’s most senior administrators.

articles.headline: Democrats See No Choice but Hillary Clinton in 2016
articles.snippet: As Hillary Rodham Clinton prepares to run for president again, amid much criticism, Democrats across the board are counting on her to restore the party’s luster.
articles.abstract: As Hillary Rodham Clinton prepares to run for president again, amid much criticism, Democrats across the board are counting on her to restore the party’s luster.
articles.lead_paragraph: They shrug off questions about Hillary Rodham Clinton’s email habits. They roll with the attacks on her family’s foundation, the big checks from foreign governments, the torpid response of her not-yet-campaign.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Confessore, Jonathan Martin and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Impasse With Congress Imperils Authorization to Combat ISIS
articles.snippet: President Obama’s request for authorization to fight the Islamic State is criticized by Republicans who say it does too little and by Democrats who say it does too much.
articles.abstract: President Obama’s request for authorization to fight the Islamic State is criticized by Republicans who say it does too little and by Democrats who say it does too much.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama’s formal request for congressional authorization to fight the Islamic State — once framed by lawmakers as a matter of great constitutional import — is now seriously imperiled because Republicans think it does too little and Democrats think it does too much.

articles.headline: A Balancing Act as Iraq Claims Gains in Tikrit
articles.snippet: A major step for the Iraqi government in fighting ISIS came with Shiite militias and Iranian military officials in a leading role, which has American officials worried.
articles.abstract: A major step for the Iraqi government in fighting ISIS came with Shiite militias and Iranian military officials in a leading role, which has American officials worried.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi declared Thursday that victory in Tikrit was near and “achieved totally by Iraqi hands” as his troops sought to root out Islamic State militants from their last few footholds in the city.

articles.headline: Asia Gears Up for Art Basel Hong Kong
articles.snippet: With a new start date, the Hong Kong fair is trying to separate itself from the pack.
articles.abstract: With a new start date, the Hong Kong fair is trying to separate itself from the pack.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — When the third edition of Art Basel Hong Kong, Asia’s hottest contemporary art fair, opens to the public on Sunday, the atmosphere will be noticeably cooler, for reasons that have less to do with the region’s overall economic slowdown than with the shift in the fair’s dates from humid May to balmy March.

articles.headline: F.C.C. Sets Net Neutrality Rules
articles.snippet: The agency said it would decide on what was acceptable on a case-by-case basis, taking on a more prominent role in the high-speed Internet arena.
articles.abstract: The agency said it would decide on what was acceptable on a case-by-case basis, taking on a more prominent role in the high-speed Internet arena.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Communications Commission on Thursday released extensive details of how it would regulate broadband Internet providers as a public utility, producing official wording that almost certainly sets the stage for extended legal fights.

articles.headline: Wondering What the Fed’s Statements Mean? Be Patient
articles.snippet: Ten years after Ben Bernanke proclaimed the end of “Fedspeak,” the Federal Reserve, try as it might, still seems to be speaking in ambiguities.
articles.abstract: Ten years after Ben Bernanke proclaimed the end of “Fedspeak,” the Federal Reserve, try as it might, still seems to be speaking in ambiguities.
articles.lead_paragraph: patient adj. “bearing or enduring pain, trouble, etc. without complaining or losing self-control; refusing to be provoked or angered, as by an insult; forbearing; tolerant; calmly tolerating delay, confusion, inefficiency, etc.” — Webster’s New World College Dictionary
